text.0: swift rapidly striking like a bull who sharpens his horns terrific stirring up the people.
text.1: with eyes that close not bellowing sole hero indra subdued at once a hundred armies.
text.2: with him loudroaring ever watchful victor bold hard to overthrow rouser of battle.
text.3: indra the strong whose hand bears arrows conquer ye warriors now now vanquish in the combat.
text.4: he rules with those who carry shafts and quivers indra who with his band rings hosts together.
text.5: foeconquering strong of arm the somadrinker with mighty bow shooting with welllaid arrows.
text.6: bṛhaspati fly with thy chariot hither slayer of demons driving off our foemen.
text.7: be thou protector of our cars destroyer victor in battle breakerup of armies.
text.8: conspicuous by thy strength firm foremost fighter mighty and fierce victorious allsubduing.
text.9: the son of conquest passing men and heroes kinewinner mount thy conquering car o indra.
text.10: cleaver of stalls kinewinner armed with thunder who quells an army and with might destroys it.
text.11: follow him brothers quit yourselves like heroes and like this indra show your zeal and courage.
text.12: piercing the cowstalls with surpassing vigour indra the pitiless hero wild with anger.
text.13: victor in fight unshaken and resistlessmay he protect our armies in our battles.
text.14: indra guide these bṛhaspati precede them the guerdon and the sacrifice and soma.
text.15: and let the banded maruts march in forefront of heavenly hosts that conquer and demolish.
text.16: ours be the potent host of mighty indra king varuṇa and maruts and Ādityas.
text.17: uplifted is the shout of gods who conquer highminded gods who cause the worlds to tremble.
text.18: bristle thou up o maghavan our weapons excite the spirits of my warring heroes.
text.19: urge on the strong steeds might o vṛtraslayer and let the din of conquering cars go upward.
text.20: may indra aid us when our flags are gathered victorious be the arrows of our army.
text.21: may our brave men of war prevail in battle ye gods protect us in the shout of onset.
text.22: bewildering the senses of our foemen seize thou their bodies and depart o apva.
text.23: attack them set their hearts on fire and burn them so let our foes abide in utter darkness.
text.24: advance o heroes win the day may indra be your sure defence.
text.25: exceeding mighty be your arms that none may wound or injure you.
